The loan will be used to stock more cartons of clothes to sell and will help Halima to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for her children as well as herself. Halima hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a very big boutique in town. 

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to stock more cartons of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 33 years old, she did not go to school, and  she is married with three children ages 12,16, and 19 who are in school and live at home.

For the past five years she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells  slippers and bread. She received a small amount from her husband  to start this business, and she  learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase slippers and bread to expand her  business. Her  plan is to educate  her children.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and bread to expand her  business

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José,  tiene un negocio de reparación de refrigeradora, lavadora, aire acondicionado. El habita con su compañera de vida y no tiene familiares en el extranjero.
El aprendió el oficio porque trabajo como empleado de cierto luego, después se independizo desde hace 10 años  y a partir  de ese momento atiende su negocio con horarios de 8:00 am - 5:00 pm o dependiendo de la demanda. El préstamo le permitirá comprar aparato eléctrico de soldadura y otros más. 
La inversión le ayudara a incrementar la demanda de sus clientes ya que contara con herramientas de primera necesidad en el trabajo. Su objetivo es comprar su casa, colocar el taller y trabajar con dinero propio.
texts.en:
José has his own business where he repairs refrigerators, dishwashers, and air conditioning. He lives with his common-law wife and has no family abroad.

He learned his trade because he worked as an employee for a time, then decided to become independent 10 years ago. Since that time, he tends to his business from 8:00am-5:00pm, or depending upon demand. The loan will allow him to purchase a soldering iron and other electronic apparatuses.

The investment will help him to increase the demand of his clients since he depends upon necessary tools for his work. His objective is to buy his own house, build a workshop and work with his own money.

loans.use: To buy a soldering iron and other things to help his appliance repair business.

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz is 49 years old, married and has three children, a 11-year-old, a 4-year-old son and a 2-year-old  daughter. Her son goes to school. Her son wants to become a firefighter. 

Firangiz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. This is Firangiz's second loan from Kiva. She is very thankful to Komak and Kiva for her first loan. She started her business 9 years ago as a clothes-selling business. Now she needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to  buy clothes for women and resell them in her shop. 

Firangiz wants to use the money from her new business to help her family. In the future, she wants to have her own store, not rent a store as she does now. This will be more profitable for her business. Firangiz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her again.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, a 31-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is married and has three children between 6 and 15 years old. All of her children are living home and attending school.

For the past 10 years she has been selling soft drinks. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the time she realizes profit, and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell at her business. She hopes to build a house, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell at her business

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es: La señora jose es una mujer preocupada por la salud de los demás, por eso por vocación escogió la especialidad de licenciatura en enfermería, la cual la ejerce en un centro de salud de la localidad donde habita, con 28 años de ejercer dicha profesión, es soltera con un hijo a su cargo, el que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar el techo y piso de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Zinc, Perlin, Cerámica, Cemento Bonds y Mano de Obra, para realizar dicha obra la que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Jose is a woman who is worried about the health of those around her, and that is why she was called to get a degree in nursing, which she practices in a health center in the area where she lives. She has 28 years of working in this profession. She is single with one child under her care, to whom she brings everything he needs to grow up. Right now, she needs to improve the ceiling of her house, so she decided to visit Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan for construction materials such as: Zinc, Perlin, Ceramics, Cement Bonds, and manual labor, in order to complete the work and everything that is necessary. This way, she will improve her living conditions and increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and labor to help improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Janet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Janet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura. El vive con sus padres y no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el negocio lo aprendió en su familia y lo realiza todos los días de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm desde hace cuatro años. El préstamo que requiere le permitirá en invertir en la preparación de dos manzanas de tierra para luego cultivar. 
La compra de este le ayudara para poder realizar el cultivo y tener mejores utilidades en el futuro. Su sueño es crecer en la agricultura y poder tener mejores ingresos para aportar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer and lives with his parents.  He does not have any relatives outside the country.  He learned this business from his family and works daily from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm and has done so for four years.  This loan will help him invest in the preparation of two plots of land so he can later farm.

This will help him plant a crop so that he can better help his family in the future.  His dream is to grow in farming and be able to have a better income with which to support his family.

loans.use: to prepare two plots of land.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is a 25-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is single and has a four-year-old child who is in school, and lives with her at home.

For the past eight years she has been selling spoons, bowls, and plates in the local market. Sometimes the buying is slow, but most of the time she realizes profit, and she use it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates to resell at her business. She hopes to build a house, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
Yawah is 49 years old and lives in Margibi County, Liberia. She is married with five children between the ages of ten and 33, two of whom live on their own and the others attend school. 

For the past twenty-five years Yawah has sold oil, pepper, salt, onions, batteries and others items from a table in her community’s market. She set up her business with money given to her by her husband and learned to sell from her mother. She enjoys selling because she makes an income and is popular in the marketplace. 

Yawah is requesting an 18,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more goods to sell from her table. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell from her table.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She resides in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya. She has been an active farmer for over ten years and she grows cash crops.

Carolyne approached Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) for the purchase of poultry. She says the business will help her educate her children. She wants to have over five thousand chickens, both broilers and layers.

Her challenge is lack of capital.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Marthaline is 20 years old. She and her fiancee live at Congo Town in Montserrado County which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancee is a driver and they have a one-year-old child at home. 

Since 2009, she has been selling plantains, bananas, and oranges in her community market. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, bananas, and oranges, for her business. In the future, she plans to send her child to school until he  finishes college.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, bananas, and oranges for her business.

loans.name: Gary Yuri

texts.es: El señor Gary Yuri tiene 22 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en un instituto, iba en el primer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente, además de que no tuvieron la suficiente solvencia económica para colaborarle con sus estudios. Actualmente alquilo una pieza junto a su hermano. El solicitante tiene 6 años de experiencia en el servicio de mecánica, actualmente trabaja como ayudante de mecánica de motocicletas en un Taller y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 12:00 pm  y de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm, el tambien sabe hacer construcciones y se esta construyendo unos cuartos para vivir. El credito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de teja para el techado de unas habitaciones que construye en un pequeño terreno para vivir.
texts.en:
Gary Yuri, age 22, is single.  He is not in a relationship, and he has no children or dependents.  He finished high school, and he was studying at an institute.  He was in his first year, but he did not manage to finish due to lack of financial resources.

He lived with his parents, but they decided to stop helping him financially so that their son would be more independent.  Also, they were not financially solvent enough to help with his education.

He now rents a floor together with his brother.  He has six years of experience as a mechanic.  He now works as an assistant motorcycle mechanic at a repair shop.  He works Mondays through Saturdays from 8:00 a.m until 12:00 p.m. and from 2:00 p.m until 6:00 p.m.

He also knows how to build, and he is building some rooms in which to live.  The loan that he is now requesting is to buy tile for the roof of some rooms that he is building on a small piece of land where he will live.

loans.use: to buy roofing tile.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
This loan will help Francisco purchase inventory and an air conditioner to regulate the temperature of his warehouse for his imported foods business.

Francisco, originally from Cuba, moved to Miami in August 2012. Several months later, he had already begun his own business. By November 2012, Francisco had rented a small office space for his business, Pilot’s Exports Spain Corp, a company that imports wines, olive oils, and other fine foods from Europe. Francisco purchases the food products directly from Spain, Italy and Portugal and then sells them to local food distributors throughout the U.S. 

Francisco is looking to expand his business and needs a loan to purchase an air conditioner for his warehouse which will allow him to purchase larger orders from Europe in order to manage more client contracts.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and an air conditioner for his storage warehouse.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as cassava, sweet potatoes, and fresh vegetables to sell, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and buy her children new clothes and bed sheets for her home. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as cassava, sweet potatoes, and fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sawo

texts.en:
Sawo lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, single and has three children. Her children are between 6 and 15 years old. They are in school, and all of them live at home. Sawo's fiancee is a businessman.

For the past three years Sawo has been selling charcoal in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business. She wishes to buy land and build her house, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business

loans.name: Quadondoya Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Quadondoya” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yei  is the featured leader of this group. Yei is 46 years old, and she is married with 4 children. Her husband is a diamond miner, and 3 of her children are attending primary school and 1 is in college.  Yei sells food at a market – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Carmelo Ramiro

texts.es:
Carmelo a sus 26 años de edad, se visiona como un gran microempresario, por lo cual ha comenzado a construir su sueño. Desde su infancia su gran pasión ha sido la avicultura, y hoy se ha convertido en la actividad que le genera los ingresos pertinentes para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Desde hace cuatro meses tomó la determinación de crear un galpón para el engorde y cría de pollos en su residencia. Se encuentra muy motivado porque tiene grandes expectativas y aunque es conciente que el trabajo es arduo no le importa más que luchar por sacar su proyecto productivo adelante y asegurarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de 70 gallinas ponedoras y cuido, con el propósito de convertirse en el mediano plazo en el mayor distribuidor de huevos y pollo de su localidad
texts.en:
26-year old Carmelo sees himself becoming an important small businessman one day. He has now started work on his dream. Even as a child he was fascinated by poultry, and today raising chickens is the way he earns a living to support his family.   

Four months ago he decided to build a coop for the chickens at his home. He is very motivated as he has big hopes for the future, and even though he knows the work is hard, nothing is more important to him than making a success of his project and providing his family with a better standard of living.

Carmelo is now seeking a loan to buy 70 laying hens and feed. His medium-term goal is to be the largest distributor of eggs and chickens in his area.

loans.use: Buy 70 laying hens and feed

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 40 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is living together with her spouse and children. She has three children, who are ages 7 to 13 years and attending school. Musu, herself, is not educated, but she sells provisions and cosmetics, a business which she manages well. She has sold these goods for the past five years without encountering any problem. Her mother assisted with some funds, which she used to start her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase more cosmetics, toothpaste, body cream, grease,etc  for her business, in order to have some sustainable future plan.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, toothpaste, body cream, grease,etc  for her business,

loans.name: Gabina Julia

texts.es: La señora Gabina tiene 35 años, trabajo de muy joven para poder estudiar, pece a los esfuerzos no pudo concluir sus estudios, trabajo con sus padres en el comercio de ropa, se caso a corta edad, tiene cuatro hijos. La señora Gabina junto a su esposo trabajaron por muchos años para poder obtener parte de su patrimonio, actualmente su esposo trabaja como albañil, y doña gabina vende ropa nueva  y discos DVD. Actualmente la señora Gabina usara el credito para poder comprar un lote urbano para poder construir su vivienda, de esta manera podra mejorar su calidad de vida brindandoles a sus hijos en un futuro una vivienda mas comoda.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabina is 35 years old. She worked when she was very young in order to be able to study. Despite her efforts, however, she was not able to finish her education. She worked with her parents selling clothing. She married at a young age and has four children.

Sra.  Gabina, along with her husband, worked for many years in order to acquire family assets. Currently her husband works in construction and she sells new clothing and DVD discs. She will use the loan to purchase a city lot to build a home on.  This way she can improve her quality of life, giving her children a better home in the future.

loans.use: to buy a city lot to build a home on

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah is 49 years old and lives in the West Point community which is a populous area in Montserrado County. She is a widow with two children ages 19 years and 28 years old. One of the children is going to school while the other is working. 

Susannah is not educated but operates a building materials business selling items such as door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc. The business has been in operation for the past 10 years without any problem. She started the business from her husband's earnings. She needs a loan to purchase materials like door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business like door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Osmin

texts.es:
Carlos,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más capital en la agricultura. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para llevar acabo el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar su cosecha y con ello tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado en gran medida y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Carlos is requesting a new loan due to the necessity of investing more capital in agriculture. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pest-control substances and insecticides to carry out the cultivation. The previous loan allowed him to increase his harvest and with it to have more income to help his family to have a better quality of life. The economic conditions improved in large measure and the family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pest-control substances and insecticides to carry out the cultivation.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
This loan will help Omar purchase necessary inventory to allow his computer distributing company to grow.

Omar began his own business, PTC Supplies Corp., a company that exports and distributes computer and printer equipment, nine years ago in his native country of Puerto Rico. After moving to Doral City, Florida in 2010, Omar decided to continue his business in the U.S. Omar currently sells to Miami-Dade elementary schools and local individuals, and he continues to sell wholesale in Latin America, maintaining clients throughout Puerto Rico and Venezuela. 

The entrepreneur hopes to gain more clients in the U.S. and is looking to expand his business. Omar needs a loan to purchase additional PC and printer equipment in order to better serve his local clients and to attract more customers across the U.S.

loans.use: to purchase computer and printer equipment to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 40-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 4 and 19, who are in school. They all live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. Sadia has been selling palm oil and charcoal in the local market for the past five and a half years. She uses a pickup truck to get her goods from the bush (village). She faces problems during the rainy season accessing the village. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory (palm oil and charcoal) before the rainy season. Her dream is to build a house for her children and further boost her business because it has gained her independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory (palm oil and charcoal) before the rainy season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 36 years old. She is married and has two children ages 6 and 12 years old, one of whom lives at home and attends school. For 6 years, she has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc. One of the problems that she faces is the rainy season because she doesn’t have a good shop.  She enjoys the interactions with her customers. The profit that she makes and having food in her home makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc., for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristobal de 47 años de edad, se dedica desde hace seis años a la comercialización de plátanos, yuca y ñame, en la plaza de mercado de su localidad. Trabaja diariamente de dos de la mañana a cinco e la tarde, en conjunto con su hija quien le colabora con las ventas. Gracias a la actividad su familia no carece de las necesidades básicas y han logrado salir adelante garantizándoles a sus hijos una educación.
Su mayor sueño es tener una bodega que le permita almacenar sus productos para que tengan una mayor durabilidad y venderlos a un mejor precio. 
Asegura que su mayor felicidad se la proporciona su familia y que el trabajo se constituye en el eje fundamental para permanecer unidos. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para mejorar sus ventas y con ello ofrecerle a su familia una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Cristobal is 47 years old. He has earned his living for six years selling plantains, yuca, and yams in his town's market square. He works every day from two o'clock in the morning until five o'clock in the evening, together with his daughter, who sells with him. Thanks to this business, his family does not lack the basic necessities and they have been able to continue guaranteeing their children an education.

Cristobal's biggest dream is to have a storehouse where he could store his produce so that it would last longer and could be sold at a better price. He affirms that his family is the source of his greatest happiness and that his work is the key to keeping them together. He is now requesting a loan for the purchase of stock to improve his sales so that he can provide his family with better economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy plantains, yuca, and yams.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2009. They are Comfort, Gladys and Matilda. They live in Dansoman. Comfort is a seamstress, Gladys sells provisions, while Matilda sells “pito” (a drink made from fermented millet or sorghum).

ID Ghana has been of great service to them, since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Matilda is 37 years old and married to Emmanuel, a 42-year-old hardware seller. They have a child. She has seven years experience. She works six days a week (Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve on her business capital. 

This is Matilda’s ninth loan with ID-Ghana. She is requesting an amount of GHS 2,400 to buy more materials, so she can sew and sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 3,600 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy more materials so she can sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted for being the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 35 years old, single, and has a 12-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. in the local market on a table. One of the problems she faces is having only a small working capital.  She enjoys the profit she makes  every day, having  money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. for her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Faith In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Faith In Action” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,500,000 SLL. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Bondu.  Bondu is age 42; she was born in Kono district, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a diamond miner, and the couple has five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Bondu has been a businesswoman for 13 years. She sells rice, palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, and the like. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the same items, on a large scale, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk, to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Join Hand Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Join Hand” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Hawa is the featured leader of this group. Hawa is 27 years old, and she is married with 1 child. Her husband is a diamond miner, and her child is attending primary school. Hawa sells food at a market - rice, palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been doing this type of business for 3 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Cony Group

texts.en:
Comfort, Victoria and Theresah make up this group. They reside in the Dansoman. They sell maize, ladies tops and panties. They have been together from 2012 to date and are still doing very well.

Comfort is a 35-year-old maize seller. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year, and she is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for 5 years now. She works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is her 3rd loan, and she needed GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Comfort, Victoria and Theresah need a total amount of GHS 2,400 to buy more items to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell to customers

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. Bendu is 27 years old. She stopped her education at second grade. She is married with three children, aged between 6 and 12,  who live at home and attend school. 

For two years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. One of the problems she faces is low income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food for her home and makes her proud of her business.

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Delmiro Antonio

texts.es:
Delmiro, de 24 años de edad es un joven trabajador a quien le ha tocado rebuscarse la vida a fin de conseguir el sustento para él y su familia. Con dos hijos menores de edad, por los cuales vela a fin de garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida, Delmiro trabaja  diariamente comercializando recipientes plásticos, actividad que aprendió gracias a su padrastro que laboraba como vendedor ambulante. 
Hoy ha logrado montar su propio negocio con sacrificio y mucha disciplina. Su mayor deseo es incrementar su capacidad de venta y ampliar su portafolio de productos para generar mejores ingresos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra se mercancía.
Asegura que la educación de sus hijos es su mayor prioridad por lo cual trata de esforzarse para garantizarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
24-year old Delmiro is a hardworking young man whose lot in life it is to support himself and his family. With two young children to care for and provide a better standard of living for, Delmiro works every day selling plastic containers, a job he learned from his stepfather who used to work as a street vendor.

Nowadays after much sacrifice and discipline he has succeeded in opening his own business. His greatest wish is to grow his inventory and increase sales so that he can earn more money. For this reason he is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise.

Delmiro explains that the education of his children is his greatest priority so he works hard in an effort to guarantee them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: Buy plastic containers

loans.name: Lovise

texts.en: Lovise live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 41 years old, and she has 5 children between 16 and 26 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items on a table. One of the problems that she faces is the rainy season.  She enjoys the interactions with her customers and the profit that she makes. Keeping busy makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items for her business

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 37 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children, ages 2, 12, 16, and 19. All of them are in school and live at home.

For the past two years, Satta has been selling rice by the cup in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

Satta hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, se dedica a la realización de viajes y venta de ladrillo de obra. Él está casado tiene 46 años, su esposa tiene 40 años de edad y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 8 y 10 años, ellos estudian.  Wilberto, lo lleva acabo desde hace 10 años y lo realiza de lunes a sábado. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de carro, anillos,  entre otros y pago de mano de obra. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del vehículo y así seguir trabajando. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer más el negocio y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Wilberto transports and sells bricks. He is 46 years old and is married. His wife is 40 years old and they have two children, 8 and 10 years old, who go to school. Wilberto has been working for 10 years and works from Monday to Saturday. He will use the loan to purchase car parts and other car accessories as well as to pay for labor. The loan will help him get his vehicle into better shape so that he can continue to work. His goal is to improve his business so he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy car parts and other car accessories, as well as to pay for labor

loans.name: Women In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Women in Action” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 3,500,000.00 SLL in order to expand on their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama. Mariama is 42 years old; she was born in Kono, in eastern Sierra Leone. Mariama is married to a security officer, and the couple has 4 children, 3 of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama has been a businesswoman for 6 years now. She sells food in a market – rice, palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. Mariama is going to use her share of this loan to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county, with her 8-month-old child. She is a junior high student. For the past 3 years, she has been selling bread in her community. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit every day because she has more customers. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives in West Point, one of the most populous and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, single, with a 12-year-old child that lives at home and is in school.

For two years she has been selling rice, oil, sardines and other items in her community. Too little income is the problem she faces now.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, sardines and other items for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, sardines and other items for her business

loans.name: Young Invistors Group

texts.en:
Musa (pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 49 years ago, he is married to a trader, and the couple has 2 children – 1 is attending primary school and the other is attending secondary school. 

For 8 years now, Musa has been selling used clothes, cloths, belts, caps, etc. Musa will use his share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand his business. He will buy cloth/clothes, belts, caps, etc., in larger quantities to add to his current stock.  

This is the first loan that Musa and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cloth/clothes, belts, caps, etc., in larger quantities to add to his current stock

loans.name: Fanah

texts.en:
Fanah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and has seven children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old. For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. One of the problems she faces is that the prices of ingredients are too high. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily. Having  money for her expanses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig feet and chicken feet, and other meats to use in her restaurant. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig feet and chicken feet, and other meats, to use at her food business

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Абдусаттор добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Он более 16 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как картофель, морковь и другие сельхоз культуры. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он живет в отдаленном регионе, где зимой очень холодно. Данный момент Абдусаттор и его семья живут в старом доме, который остался от родителей. Их дом имеет плохое состояние и поэтому ему нужно срочно проводить капитальный ремонт.  Так как он потратил все свои сбережения для нового посева, он не имеет денег для ремонта. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему улучшить условию проживания и таким образом принесет радость и уют в его доме.
texts.en: Abdusattor is a conscientious, goal-oriented and hard-working man. He is married and has four children. He has been farming for more then 16 years and grows potatoes, carrots and other crops. His wife helps Abdusattor in his business. They live in a remote region of Tajikistan where it's very cold. Abdusattor's family lives now in an old house that they inherited from their parents. The house is decrepit and needs to be repaired. Abdusattor has used up all of his savings to plant the spring crops, so he has no money left over for home improvement. He is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to purchase building materials such as cement, lumber and paint to perform house repairs. Abdusattor waits for your kindess. This loan will help him improve the living conditions of his family and bring happiness and comfort to his home.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint for repairing house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, single, and has a 19-year-old child who is in school and lives at home.

She has been selling rice, sugar, candles and others items, in her community. Too little income is the problem she faces now. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, sugar, candles, and others items to resell at her business. Her dream is to have a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, sugar, candles, and others items to resell at her business

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de invertir más en el cultivo de granos básicos. Este le ayudara a comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, plaguicidas, insecticidas, herbicidas, entre otros.
Con el préstamo anterior aumento la productividad y sus ingresos los invirtió en la alimentación del hogar. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y la situación familiar se mantienen estables.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest more in the cultivation of basic grains. This loan will help him to buy agricultural supplies such as: soil ammendments, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides.
With his previous loan he increased his productivity and invested his income in feeding his household. His economic conditions have improved and his family situation remains stable.

loans.use: to buy soil ammendments, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and other items.

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 39 years old and has two children aged 9 and 22 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items on a table. One of the problem that she face is the rainy season. She enjoys the interactions with her customers and the profit that she makes. Keeping busy makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business. Her plans are to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, etc., for her business

loans.name: Carrizal Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Ingrid Rosaura de estado civil casada, tiene 35 años de edad, curso 3 años de educacion secundaria, tiene 2 hijos y uno de ellos está estudiando, se dedica a comprar frutas y refacciones para vender, inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y hasta la fecha lleva 7 años de experiencia. Cuenta también con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al trabajo de chofer.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que le va servir para la compra de frutas y refacciones para la venta; en el futuro quiere tener mas capital y poder vender más para obtener mejores ganancias. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tienda de artículos de consumo diario, vender cosméticos y a vender frutas.
texts.en:
Ingrid Rosaura is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is studying. Ingrid did 3 years of high school. She buys fruits and snacks for selling. She started the business following her mother's teachings and has 7 years experience. Her husband works as a driver.
She has organized a communal bank to ask for a loan which will help her to buy fruits and snacks to sell. The other members of the communal bank have an everyday products store, sell cosmetics and sell fruits.
In the future, Ingrid wants to increase her resources in order to improve sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase fruit for selling

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru: Уктам по натуре добрый человек. У него все прекрасно и с лицо и душа и мысли. Он живет в селе и с детства занимался скотоводством. Дополнительно он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Он в основном выращивает пшеницу и картошку. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Он имеет 7 детей. Он очень хороший отец. Уктам всегда мечтал иметь высшее образование, но по семейным обстоятельствам, он не смог получить высшее образования. Он в прошлом году отправил свою дочь в столицу для продолжения учебы в университете. Он хочет реализовать свою мечту в своих детях. Также он хочет, чтобы его дети жили в хороших условиях. Он планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но недавно он отправил все свои деньги для оплаты учебного договора дочери. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для проведения капитального ремонта. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Uktam is a kind man. He has a good face and a good soul and a good mind. Uktam lives in the country and raises cattle. He also grows crops to supplement the family's income, mainly wheat and potatoes. Uktam's wife helps him with the farm. They have seven children together and Uktam is a good father to them all. Uktam has always dreamed to go to college but his family circumstances prevented that. Last year he was able to send his eldest daughter to university in the capital of Dushanbe. Uktam hopes to be able to send all of his children to college. He also wants his children to have good living conditions at home. Uktam needs to repair his house, but he has sent all of his savings to pay for his daughter's education in Dushanbe. That is why Uktam is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni which he will use to purchase building materials to repair his house. He awaits your kindess.

loans.use: To buy building materials for house repair

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.ru: Озодчон человек с открытой душой и добрым сердцем. Он всю свою жизнь посветил своей семье. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Старшая дочь совершеннолетняя и двое еще не совершеннолетние. Его жена Инобат занимается услугой швеи и таким образом помогает мужу для содержания детей. Несколько лет назад Озодчон начал свой бизнес скотоводством. Дополнительно он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры как помидор, огурцы и рис. Его жена помогает ему введение бизнеса. Озодчон должен увеличить свой доход, так как дети выросли и требуют больше благ. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки дойной коровы. Он обещает погасить займ во время, так как Озодчон является повторным клиентом ИМОН и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Ozodjon is a man with an open soul and a kind heart. He has dedicated his life to his family. Ozodjon is married and has three children. His eldest daughter is an adult but the other tow are still teenagers. Ozodjon's wife Inobat works as a seamstress and so helps his husband raise the children. A couple of years ago Ozodjon has startes a cattle business. He also grows tomatoes, cucumbers and rice on his farm. Ozodjon needs to increase the family's income because his children are growing and need more money. He is taking out this loan of 5000 somoni to purchase a milk cow. He promises to repay the loan on time. Ozodjon has been a client with IMON before and has a good credit history. He hopes for your kindess.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Шерзоду 28 лет. Он добрый и честный человек. Его соседи очень любят его за его честность и трудолюбие и с радостью используют его услуги такси. Он женат, но не имеет детей. Шерзод более 5 лет занимается услугой такси с целью получения больше дохода. Его жена Дилдора занимается скотоводством, та как они живут в отдаленном регионе и их местожительство весьма благополучный для скотоводства. Он давно мечтает стать отцом и поэтому старается развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода, чтобы создать условия для будущих детей. Он недавно сделал капитальный ремонт своей машины. Итак, его машина имеет хорошее состояние и его клиенты довольны его услугой. Он планирует провести мероприятие, но не имеет денег, так как он потратил все свои сбережения для ремонта машины. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 долларов США для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sherzod is 28 years old. He is a kind and honest man. His neighbors really like him for his honesty and hard working attitude and gladly use his taxi services. Sherzod is married but has no children. For more then five years he has been running a taxi service so that his family has a higher monthly income. His wife Dildora raises cattle as the two live in a remote region of Tajikistan optimal for ranching. Sherzod hopes to become a father and so strives to expand his business and raise his profits so that he can create a good home for his future children. Recently he repaired his taxi cab and used all of his savings for that. Now his car is in good condition and his clients are happy with it. However, Sherzod has to organize an event/party but has no more savings left for it. That is why he is requesting a loan of 1500 dollars. He hopes for your kindess.

loans.use: To make a ceremony

loans.name: Dolores Elena

texts.es: Dolores de 52 años de edad es madre de tres hijos; Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la confección directa y de terceros. Aprendió la labor gracias a una amiga quien le enseño el oficio. Trabaja en su taller diariamente de seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde. En la actualidad Dolores se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una maquina ojaladora e insumos, con la cual mejorará los tiempos de entrega y la calidad en el servicio. Con esta inversión podrá incrementar sus ingresos y le garantizará a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Su mayor sueño es tener un gran taller de confecciones y con este generar empleos directos a otras personas.
texts.en: Dolores is 52 years old and has three children. For over 20 years, she has been making clothes and selling directly to customers and through third parties. She learnt the trade thanks to a friend who showed her how to become a tailor. She works daily in her workshop from 6am to 4pm. Currently, Dolores is requesting a loan to purchase a buttonholer as well as to buy supplies, which will allow her to improve delivery times and customer service. With this loan, she will be able to increase her earnings and insure her family has a better life. Her greatest dream is to someday own a large tailoring workshop where she could offer employment to others.

loans.use: to buy a buttonholer as well as supplies

loans.name: Zifnunby

texts.ru: Зифнунби 43 года. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. У этой прекрасной женщине очень тяжелая судьба, так как с мужем она развелась и осталась без детей. Она живет одна и обеспечивает себя сама. Она живет в квартире своих родителей. Более 6 месяцев она работает дворником в государственной организации. До этого она работала во многих местах. Она хочет купить себе кровать, так как она спит на полу, а также она планирует купить стол и стул. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zifnunby is 43 years old. She is a hard working and goal oriented woman. Zifnunby has had a hard life - she divorced her husband and is child-less. She lives separately in her parent's house and provides for herself alone. For more then six months she has been working as a janitor for a government office. Before she worked in other places as well. Zifnunby wants to buy herself a bed because right now she sleeps on the floor and also hopes to buy a table and a chair. She is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to finance this furniture purchase. She hopes for your kindess.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Arcelia

texts.es: Arcelia con su crédito anterior compró frutas y verduras que distribuyó en las tiendas, logrando aumentar el número de sus clientes, sus inventarios y obtuvo una mayor rentabilidad. Su negocio mejoró el surtido y por eso está muy agradecida con los finaciadores de Kiva, porque la ayudaros al crecimiento de su negocio. En la actualidad está alicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará lácteos, aguacates, verduras y muchas frutas tropicales pues está aprovechando la temporada en la cual aumenta el volumen de sus ventas, lo cual hará que la inversión de su Kiva tenga éxito..
texts.en:
With her previous loan, Arcelia purchased fruits and vegetables which she distributed to stores. She increased the number of customers and her stock and improved profitability. Her business increased the range offered and she is grateful to Kiva for helping her make her business grow.
With her new loan from kiva she will purchase dairy products, avocados, vegetables and many tropical fruits, making the most of the season in which her sales increase, which will make her investment successful.

loans.use: to purchase dairy, avocados, vegetables and tropical fruits

loans.name: Hugues

texts.en:
Hugues lives in Rendel, in the South Department of Haiti, an area with erratic access to electricity and is also very vulnerable to flooding due to deforestation. He is married and has 12 children in school. He is a community leader and he is the one of our best trustworthy retailers. He has had a store for 5 years that sells mobile phone top-up cards and charges cell phones with an inverter. He has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as clean energy entrepreneur.
He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan but he is seeking a loan of 2000 USD to grow up his business because he has many demands in our big solar system as:  Powa Pack Jr, SHS 10W, 15W and efficient cook stoves.
With a Kiva loan, Hugues will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Auguste

texts.en:
Auguste lives in Chantal, in the South Department of Haiti. He has had a grocery store for 17 years that sells food supplies. He has started to sell clean energy products with EarthSpark as clean energy entrepreneur. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan but he is seeking another loan of 400 USD. 
With a Kiva loan, Auguste will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Titin

texts.en:
Mrs Titin used to be a junior high school teacher and is nowadays housewife. Titin thinks that selling Nazava Water filters is a great business opportunity because she can augment her household income whilst fulfilling her household duties at the same time.  
Titin lives in Cikarang which is part of the greater Jakarta agglomeration of over 28 million people. In this area nobody has potable water from their tap. Many people use well water which is often very dirty. To get safe drinking water people have to buy water which is very expensive. That is why Titin started to sell Nazava Water Filters and so far with great success. Within a month she has ordered 3 times and each time all her filters were sold out very quickly.
“Selling the Nazava filters for drinking water and for filtering household water for washing and cooking are a very appropriate business opportunity here in Cikarang and surroundings. I hope that using this KIVA loan, I can become the largest agent in the greater Jakarta region”.
The KIVA loan allows Titin to save on shipping costs, enables her to expand more quickly and will therefore provide more people with safe and affordable drinking water.

loans.use: to expand water filter sales and increase the access to safe and affordable drinking water in Cikarang, West Java, Indonesia.

loans.name: Leivy Marian

texts.es: Leivy de 28 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora, que decidió montar su propio negocio con el fin de generar una fuente de ingresos para su sustento y el de su madre. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la venta de ropa. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito  para la compra de mercancía con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes. Espera con esta inversión generar mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y poder cumplir su gran sueño de tener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Leivy is 28 years old. She is an enterprising woman who decided to start her own business to generate a source of income to sustain herself and her mother. For six years, she has earned her living selling clothes. 

Now, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise so that she can fill customer orders. She hopes that with this investment, she will generate more income, allowing her to improve her quality of life and enabling her to attain her big dream of owning her own clothing store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: María Noralba De Fátima

texts.es:
Noralba de 51 años de edad es madre de seis hijos y toda su vida se ha dedicado a laborar con el fin de brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida. Desde hace cuatro años trabaja en su propio negocio el cual logró abrir gracias a su esfuerzo, años de trabajo y sacrificio, en el que se dedica a la venta de alimentos y bebidas. Gracias a su actividad hoy su familia goza de una mejor calidad de vida y no carecen de ninguna necesidad básica.
Su gran sueño es posicionar su negocio y convertirlo en el más reconocido de su localidad, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de un enfriador, greca y olla para la prestación de un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Noralba is 51 years old.  She has six children and has worked all her life to give them the best opportunities in life. For the past four years she has been running her own business selling food and beverages. She was able to open this business after years of hard work and sacrifice. Today, thanks to this activity, her family enjoys a better quality of life and they don’t lack any of the basic necessities.

Her biggest dream is to make her business the best known in her area. For this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a cooler, a coffee maker and a pot in order to better serve her customers.

loans.use: purchase a cooler, a coffee maker and a pot.

loans.name: Mónica Marcela

texts.es:
Mónica Marcela de 39 años de edad, es una empresaria que le sobran ganas de trabajar para salir adelante. Tiene una ebanistería ubicada en la zona urbana del municipio de Santa bárbara, Colombia. Aprendió el oficio por tradición familiar y se dedicó a esta labor desde hace ocho años. Se especializó en terminados como lijado y pintura. Asegura que su negocio es una gran bendición para ella y su familia porque gracias a la actividad a podido suministrarles educación a sus dos hijos menores de edad y generar empleo a dos personas de su comunidad.
Su deseo es seguir creciendo en el sector por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de madera y dos máquinas colilladora y ruteadora. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar los tiempos de fabricación y mejorará la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Mónica Marcela is 39 years old. She is a business woman who works hard to get ahead.  She has a wood working business located in the urban zone in the town of Santa Bárbara, Colombia. She has been working in this business for eight years and learned from her family as wood working is a family tradition. Her specialty is sanding and painting. She says that this business is a great blessing for her and her family because, thanks to this activity, she is able to provide her two minor children with an education and employ two other people in her community.

Her dream is to continue growing her business in her area and so, for this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy wood, a chop saw and a router.  This will help her improve her production time and the quality of her products.

loans.use: purchase wood, a chop saw and a router.

loans.name: Assatu

texts.en:
Assatu is 27 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is married and has two children, ages 2 and 14. Her children are in school and live at home.

For the past seven years she has been selling personal items, like earrings, body creams, soaps, etc., in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more earrings, body creams, soaps, etc., to resell at her business. She hopes to improve her business and send her children to high-quality schools.

loans.use: to purchase more earrings, body creams, soaps, etc., for her business inventory

loans.name: Watta

texts.en:
Watta lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old, single and has three children between 7 and 12 years old. Her children are in school, and all of them live at home. Her children's father is a businessman.

For the past three years she been selling charcoal, soft drinks and other items, in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more charcoal, soft drinks, etc., to resell at her business. She wishes to buy land and build her house, in the future,

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, soft drinks, etc., to resell at her business

loans.name: Denia

texts.es: Denia, tiene 22 años, esta casada y tiene un hijo pequeño, con quienes vive en la casa de sus suegros .El trabajo de Denia, consiste en la venta de golosinas, trabaja de manera ambulatoria y en ocasiones vende en su casa en donde instala una mesa y ofrece sus productos como galletas, chicles y caramelos. Es muy conocida por su buen humor y carisma, lo cual ha hecho que sus ventas le den los ingresos económicos que requiere; la necesidad de ser independiente y los gastos familiares que ha diario tenía que cubrir fueron los motivos principales que le llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo, lleva ya 05 años en esta actividad, al principio sentía que era muy tímida para hacerlo pero con el tiempo pudo desarrollar sus cualidades y ahora vende mucho y está muy contenta por eso.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y hacerlos reír, considera que lo más difícil es tener que vender bajo los fuertes rayos del sol, le encantaría tener una tienda de golosinas en donde pueda vender con mayor comodidad y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes.Este es el crédito número 03 con Kiva y está muy contenta al saber que tiene un apoyo financiero que le brinde la garantía de continuar trabajando con facilidad, por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas . En esta oportunidad solicitará  S/. 1200 soles para la compra de golosinas al por mayor tales como galletas , caramelos , chicles , entre otros.
texts.en: Denia is 22 years old. She is married and has a young son. She lives with her husband and son at her in-laws' house. Her works consists of selling sweet treats; she sells her products door-to-door, and also has, on occasion, sold them from home, where she displays them on a table. She sells products such as sweets, cookies and gum. She is well-known for her charisma and sunny disposition, which have helped her sell her products and thus gather the economic revenue that she needs. She started this line of work 5 years ago as she wanted to be independent and to help with the family's daily expenses. When she first started her business, she felt very shy to be doing this kind of work; but with time, she was able to develop the personal qualities called for and she now generates a lot of sales and is very happy to do so. What she likes best about her work is talking with clients and getting them to laugh; she thinks the most difficult part of the business is having to sell when it is very hot outside. She would love to have a shop where she could sell her products more easily and where she could offer more variety to her clients. This is her 3rd Kiva loan; she is very happy to have such financial support, which gives her the opportunity to continue to work with ease; she is committed to paying back her loan on time. At this time, she is requesting a loan of S/.1200 soles to purchase sweet treats (such as cookies, candy and gum) wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase sweet treats, such as cookies, candy and gum.

loans.name: Shalom 3 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of the “Shalom 3 & 5” group, located in the town of Hato Mayor, which is one of the most rural towns in the Dominican Republic, surrounded by mountains and lush vegetation. Maria is the mother of three children, but only one lives with her and her long-term partner. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is to finish building her own house. Her favorite activities are working and doing business.

Maria has been running a business selling clothing for around seven years, since receiving her first loan from us. This will be her 13th loan, having repaid her previous ones satisfactorily. Maria will use it to purchase jeans, shirts, underwear and women's clothes such as blouses, skirts, underwear, etc.

Maria is planning to save her profits to build her house and make plans for her future. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rayo De Luz 1 Group

texts.en:
Aida is the coordinator of her group "Rayo de Luz" (Ray of Light) 1. This group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, where the sugarcane harvest and tourist industry dominate the economy. The group members are dedicated to selling cloth, food, shoes and many other miscellaneous products in their “batey” community (generally made up of poor, migrant workers) and others nearby.

Aida has had her business for approximately four years, starting with some savings she had. She plans to use this loan to invest in her food store "Colmado", where she sells rice, beans, sugar, canned food, vegetables, meat, and other goods. With this loan, she will invest in her business by increasing her inventory. 

Aida says her most difficult challenge has been to improve her business and introduce more products. She also added that, thanks to the Lord and these loans, she has been able to increase her economic activities. One of her favorite things to do is to serve. 

Aida is excited about her sixth loan with Esperanza. She will use the profits to improve her business. Aida thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, canned food, etc.

loans.name: Jose Rosa

texts.es:
El Sr. José se dedica a la venta de productos químicos para el hogar, son productos de limpieza; tales como jabon liquido y en polvo, fibras para limpieza,deinfectate,escobas,trapeadores entro otros; hace casi 2 años que emprendió su negocio el cual atiende desde muy temprano por las mañanas, cuenta ya con un numero importante de clientes y es muy conocido en su localidad por su amable servicio y calidad de sus productos, por la noche para lograr un ingreso adicional y lograr su objetivo, trabaja como valet parking  en un centro de espectáculos; donde igualmente es reconocido por su amabilidad y buen trato.
José vive con su mama quien ya es de edad avanzada y conjuntamente con su hermana le apoya en el cuidado y atencion de ella;  José ve mucho potencial en su negocio pues la demanda de sus productos es cada vez mayor, comenta que atribuye el crecimiento de su negocio a; ademas de la calidad de sus productos, al buen humor y trato que da a sus clientes; requiere para ello el apoyo a traves de un credito que le permita tener mas inventario y acrecentar su linea de productos.
El objetivo de José es llegar a tener un local grande cerca de su casa  y  acrecentar sus ventas mediante la distribucion al mayoreo de sus productos y de esta forma poder dar trabajo adicional a su familia y a personas de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Señor José sells chemical products for the home. They are cleaning products such as liquid and powdered soaps, brushes for cleaning, disinfectants, brooms, and mops, among other items. It has been almost 2 years since he set up his business, which he tends from very early in the morning. He already has a significant number of customers and is very well known in his area for his friendly service and the quality of his products. In the evenings, to obtain an additional income and reach his goal, he works in valet parking at an event center, where he is equally well known for his friendliness and good service.

José lives with his mother, who is of advanced age, and together with his sister, he helps in the care of and attention to his mother. José sees great potential in his business, since the demand for his products is increasingly greater. He comments that he attributes the growth of his business to, in addition to the quality of his products, his cheery disposition and the treatment he gives his customers. 

José's goal is to have a large shop near his home and increase his sales through the bulk distribution of his products and in this way to be able to give additional work to his family and people from his community. To do this, he needs the support of a loan that will allow him to have more inventory and expand his line of products.

loans.use: to buy chemical products.

loans.name: Haja

texts.en: Haja lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known areas in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children, ages 9, 12, and 19. All of her children are in school and live at home. For ten years now she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells cement. She received a little money from her husband to start her business, which she learned from her mother. She likes her business because she earns a good profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of cement for her  business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement

loans.name: Nohelia Del Rosario

texts.es: Nohelia de 60 años, es una mujer emprendedora, que ha luchado toda su vida por sostenerse, debido a que sus padres fallecieron cuando aún era muy joven y por lo cual asumió responsabilidades a temprana edad. Gracias a su experiencia esta mujer se convirtió en una guerrera que no se ha dejado vencer por las circunstancias adversas. Toda su vida laboró en diferentes almacenes de su localidad por lo cual adquirió la experiencia que hoy la ha convertido en una gran microempresaria. En la actualidad se dedica a la comercialización de ropa, calzado y accesorios desde su hogar y dos veces por semana recorre las calles de su municipio ofreciendo su mercancía. Hoy se encuentra se solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos que sus clientes le solicitaron.
texts.en: Nohelia is sixty years old. She is an enterprising woman who has worked all her life in order to support herself, since her parents passed away when she was still very young and she had to take on responsibilities at an early age. Because of her experience, this woman became a fighter who hasn't let adverse circumstances overcome her. All her life she worked in different local shops, where she gained the experience that has made her into a great microentrepreneur. She currently works selling clothing, shoes, and accessories from home and twice a week she goes out on the streets of her town offering her merchandise. Today she is requesting a loan to purchase stock so that she can fulfill the orders her customers have requested from her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: San Martin De Tours Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE TOURS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huarocondo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Yolanda ella es casada y tiene 51 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y trigo,la socia lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ganadería, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to San Martín de Tours Communal Bank, located in the Huarocondo district of the province of Anta and department of Cusco.

Yolanda, 51, is a member.  She's married and has two children.  She works in her agriculture business.  She has a plot of cropland where she grows corn, potatoes, and wheat, and sells it in the various markets.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has been in this business for eight years already and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.

She's requesting this loan to buy seed and fertilizer.

The member who is attached to the group photo got permission to take the photo later because of work.

The businesses of the other members are livestock sales, food sales, a grocery store, and animal sales.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and she pledges to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Justo Jose

texts.es:
El señor Justo José, trabaja en actividades de construcción en una empresa constructora. De ahí proviene su fuente de ingresos. Vive en un municipio de Managua con su familia. 
     
Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en  la reparación de su casa, lo cual será reforzamiento de paredes y reparación de techo. Estas mejoras le permitirán reparar su vivienda.

 Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su vivienda   de forma que esto le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia al mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Justo Jose is a construction worker at a construction company. This is where his source of income comes from. He lives in a town near Managua with his family. He is asking for a loan from our institution to invest in home repairs. He will reinforce the walls and repair the roof. He is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the confidence that they have in him. He will invest this loan in a way that will improve his living conditions and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his home and buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es:
Anastacia, de 43 años de edad , esta casada con Paulino y juntos tienen 6 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia .Hace 22 años que comenzó con la agricultura, sembrando alverja y papa en todas sus variedades. Según cuenta tiene diferentes terrenos agrícolas que se sitúan en diferentes zonas de su localidad. A mediados de año ella se dirige a la capital del país donde vende los alimentos que produce a un mayor precio ,además de dedicarse a la ganadería, donde ara la tierra con la ayuda de su ganado. Toda esta actividad los realiza con el apoyo de su esposo, ya que hace poco incursionó en la venta de productos coméstibles, donde vende arroz , azúcar, leche , huevos , entre otros. Éste sería su noveno crédito con KIVA y da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales.
Anastacia, invertirá los S/.3900 soles para la compra de útiles de escritorio para la temporada escolar,semillas para sus sembrios y distintos productos coméstibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 43 years old.  She is married to Paulino and together they have six children.  They live in their own house.  Twenty-two years ago they began working in agriculture, sowing peas and all varieties of potatoes.  She tells us that they have different bits of land around the town.  Mid-year Anastacia goes to Lima to sell her products at a better price.  They also have livestock which they use to help plough the land.  Anastacia does all this work with the help of her husband as recently they started selling foods such as rice, sugar, milk and eggs.  This will be Anastacia's ninth loan with Kiva and she gives her word that she will make her repayments on time.

Anastacia will invest the 3900 Nuevo Soles to buy school materials for the term, seeds and various products to sell in her store.

loans.use: to buy school materials and food products.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: La Sra. azucena es una mujer de 38 años, es ama de casa, comerciante y madre de 2 hijos. Ella para poder ayudarle a los gastos familiares a su esposo  se dedica a la venta de productos de una marca reconocida. Ella desempeña el  puesto de coordinadora y sabe como satisfacer las necesidades sus clientes. El esfuerzo que realiza es por un gran motivo; dejar un buen patrimonio a sus hijos  para cuando estén grandes y es por eso que solicita ayuda por medio de kiva  para poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Azucena, age 38, is a housewife, merchant, and mother of two children.  She sells brand name products in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.
