Рахматулло еще не женатый мужчина, и планирует жениться на любимой девушке после окончания университета. Он учится на 3 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета по специальности Управлении бизнеса. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1100 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo, aged 21, is a very active young man.  He is one of the best students and does very well at his studies.  In his spare time, he provides taxi services.  Thanks to this activity, he makes some money to support his family, because his parents are getting older and they live on a small salary.

Rahmatullo is not married yet.  He is planning to marry his girlfriend after he graduates from university.  He is a third-year student at the Tajik National University, majoring in business management.  He needs to pay his tuition fees, but does not have enough money to do so.  He is requesting a loan of $1,100 to pay for his tuition.  He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his third year at university, where he studies Business Management .

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon trabaja  en un centro de salud de la comunidad donde vive, inicio como conductor y ahora se desempeña como oficial de estadísticas con 15 años de laborar en dicho centro, es casado  con 3 hijos a los que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo,  actualmente está presentando una urgencia de mejorar la pared y techo  de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; perlin 2x4, Bloques, cemento, zinc calibre 28 y arena,  para realizar dicha obra de mejorar la pared y techo que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Marlon works in a health center in the community where he lives. He started out as a driver and now he is a statistics official who has worked at the center for 15 years. He is married with three children, to whom he gives his full support for their development. Right now, he urgently needs to improve the wall and roof of his home, which is why he decided to visit Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials. He needs 2x4 beams, cinderblocks, cement, 28 caliber metal roofing, and sand. With this he will repair the wall and ceiling that he needs to do, and this way improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 2x4 beams, cinderblocks, cement, 28 caliber metal roofing, and sand.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru:
Джамшед мужчина в возрасте 34 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Жена домохозяйка,занимается воспитанием детей. Джамшед дома занимается откормом скота, также он работает на поле, у него свой виноградник, на поле работа трудная и требует многих затрат, семья Джамшеда помогают и усердно работают для того чтобы летом получить хороший урожай. Но основным доходом у Джамшеда является скотоводство. От этого вида деятельности он получает очень хорошую прибыль.  
Джамшед обратился в Арванд чтобы получить кредит.  Он планирует приобрести несколько голов мелко рогатого скота и дойную корову.  Его жена хорошо умеет доить корову, поэтому Джамшед хочет  купить корову для жены. Его жена будет в будущем доить корову и продавать молоко своим соседям и знакомым,таким образом увеличивая свой доход. Джамшед заранее благодарит организацию Кива за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Jamshed is 34 years old, married, and the father of four children.  His wife stays at home to take care of the children.  

Jamshed is involved in fattening livestock at home.  He also cultivates some land and has his own vineyard.  This type of work is difficult and costly. His family helps him and they all work very hard to get a good harvest in the summer.  However, Jamshed's main income comes from animal husbandry, an activity from which he makes very good profits.

Jamshed has turned to MDO Arvand to get a loan.  He is planning to purchase several head of small livestock and a dairy cow.  His wife milks cows very well, so he would like to buy her a cow.  In the future, Jamshed's wife will milk the cow and sell its milk to their friends and neighbors, thus increasing the family's income.

Jamshed thanks Kiva in advance for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy some livestock.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, de 45 años de edad, esta casada con Julio quien se dedica a la ganadería y con quien tiene 03 hijos. Vive en casa de su esposo con sus hijos.Victoria se dirige a la venta de bebidas gasificadas y cuando está en su casa, ordena, almacena y exhibe las bebidas de diversas marcas, presentaciones, sabores y tamaños.Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 05 años y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante ya que durante el tiempo que lleva realizando éste negocio se dio cuenta que los clientes tienen gustos variados y siempre tiene una gran cantidad de clientes , a su vez , espera seguir manteniendo su negocio.Este es el crédito número 06 con Kiva, por tanto espera de su colaboración par continuar con sus objetivos y se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas de diversas marcas y presentaciones, para tener en stock disponible para la venta, ya que por el incremento de la temperatura las ventas se incrementan.
texts.en:
Victoria is 45 years old, she is married to Julio, a rancher, and together they have three children. She lives in her husband's house with their children. Victoria works selling soft drinks and when she is home she orders, stocks, and displays drinks of different sizes and flavors and from various distributors and brands. She has been doing this work for five years and right now she depends on the help of an employee, as she realized while running this business that she always has a lot of customers and that her customers have a variety of tastes. All the same, she hopes to continue managing her business. This is her sixth loan with Kiva, hence her for their collaboration so that she can keep pursuing her goals. She also promises to continue making punctual payments on her loan. 

With the amount of 1000 soles requested Victoria will purchase soft drinks from various brands and distributors to have in stock and available for sale, as with the increase in temperatures there is likewise an increase in sales.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Sreytouch

texts.en: A 27-year-old mother of two children who are still in school, Sreytouch is a local villager from Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She depends on a single business exclusively; cloth tailoring, which she has done for four years. Sreytouch has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is seeking the first loan to renovate her house. She hopes to own a decent house for her kids.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Emeli

texts.en:
Emeli is a 23-year-old, married woman who has one child. She has a big plantation, and she grows taro, taamu, yams and bananas, to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Emeli has requested a loan to buy farming tools and supplies, including: chemicals, bush knives, rakes and weed killer. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Emeli hopes not only to improve her plantation and support her family, but also to save more money for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy farming tools and supplies, including: chemicals, bush knives, rakes and weed killer

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en:
Phon, an elderly, 56-year-old, widowed mother of five children, resides in EK Phnom district, Battambang province. Phon is a local farmer who does rice cropping and peanut growing, as her main source of income. She has been with this business for 30 years.

Including this loan cycle, Phon is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Since the past loan, she has been able to provide daily, decent food for her family, and maintain her business. Now, she forms a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy rice seed and potash, and to pay the fee for plowing her land. She highly believes that she can sustain her living and make her business grow well.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and potash, and to pay the fee for plowing her land

loans.name: Kimsun

texts.en:
Kimsun, 52, is married and has five children. Her main source of family income is from two hectares of rice farming, and her husband is the manpower supplier. She has been involved in the current business for 32 years. Currently, she is able to earn up to 27,700 Riel (KHR) per day.

Kimsun is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has used her previous loan in an effective way to improve her livelihood at a gradual pace. Now, she is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She will use it to buy a plot of farmland, potash, rice seed, and to pay a fee for plowing the land. She hopes that she can grow her crop fruitfully and gain a high yield, so she can make triple income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland, potash, rice seed, and to pay a fee for plowing the land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Odalma Lisseth

texts.es:
Odalma, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de hacerle otras mejoras al vehículo y comprar repuestos tales como llantas, cambio de aceite y batería, engrase y otros más que requiere. 
Con el crédito anterior logro hacerle los pequeños ajustes al cario y mejorar algunas luces delanteras y laterales. La familia ha disminuido ya que hace un poco tiempo atrás falleció su madre pero ella sigue adelante a pesar de ello. Su objetivo es tener en buenas condiciones su vehículo, mejorar su vivienda e ir creciendo.
texts.en: Odalma needs a new loan because she needs to make other improvements to her vehicle and buy replacement parts like tires. She also need to change the oil and the battery, lubricate parts, and other things. With the previous loan, she was able to make small adjustments to the car and improve the tail lights and head lights. The family is smaller now, because her mother passed away not too long ago, but Odalma is moving forward despite this. Her goal is to get her car in good condition, improve her house, and continue to grow.

loans.use: to buy tires, change the oil and the battery, lubricate, and other things.

loans.name: Ruth Catalina

texts.es: La Sra. Ruth se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  también tiene una tienda donde expone estos productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Ruth va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La Sra. Ruth va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, La Sra. Ruth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada e la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Ruth makes a living selling cosmetics via catalog. She sells her products by visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz. She also has a store where she displays the products. The loan is her first with this institution, and Ruth plans to use it to purchase cosmetics wholesale and on special and in this way provide a wider variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. Her reason for requesting the loan is to continue improving her business. Ruth is going to use the proceeds to keep buying more beauty products. She is a very hardworking person and feels happy about the opportunity provided by the loan.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics wholesale.

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Sokhorn, a mother of two children residing in Dambae district, of Kampong Cham province, is a farmer who does rice and cassava cultivation to support her daily cost of living. She has engaged in the current business for four years and is able to earn up to 28,500 KHR per day.

Sokhorn is in her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely used her past loan to support her business progressively, especially for her cassava crop. She has completely repaid her past loan, too. Now, she is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR. She will use it to buy insecticide, and to pay fees for ploughing and weeding the farmland. She hopes to grow her cash-crops on time and get a yield at least double the past one, so that she can make more profit for her kids' sake.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, and to pay fees for ploughing and weeding the farmland

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a camera-shy, truly ambitious businesswoman, and a unique lady in Iraq. She is 36 years old and for the past three years has been running a great fitness center for woman in a large city in North Iraq. 

She has a degree from a technical institute and found her passion and source of income in creating a fitness center for woman--a fantastic business idea in a city where most fitness centers and gyms are open to men only with limited times and services allocated to women clients.

Her center is in a rented building, and she started it with an initial 20,000 dollar investment. The interior has recently undergone a nice renovation, and it is ready to reopen with freshly painted walls and a welcoming, pleasant atmosphere. Her current assets in the project are app. 27,000 dollars, and she has been able to hire three women as her employees to work in the center in various functions.

To complete the refurbishment of the center Hannah would like to buy some additional equipment to better accommodate her customers' needs during busy hours in the gym. She plans to buy treadmills, elliptical machines, and stationary bikes. Based on her plans, she applied for a SME loan* from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. Hannah sees the investment providing her with a 7% increase in her income. 

Hannah is not only a great businesswoman, she is a wife and mother and a role model for many in her community. 

*Relief International Microfinance Iraq provides qualified clients with a loan product specifically tailored for Small and Medium Enterprises (or SMEs).

loans.use: to buy an additional work-out machine for the women's fitness center

loans.name: Houch

texts.en:
Houch, age 64 and a mother who has been blessed with two children, is a resident of Kandal Province. In this area, rice farming is one of the common businesses. Like many of her neighbors, Houch does rice farming, on two hectares of land. She has been in this business for ages -- 40 years!

Including this loan cycle, she is a second-cycle client of VisionFund, Kiva's partner. She has fully paid back her past loan and has managed to use it in a smart way, to upgrade her livelihood. For this cycle, she is going to use part of her loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland, and part of it to buy pigs for raising, to earn additional income. She hopes to earn more income from her business and sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland, and to buy pigs for raising

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha, 31, is from a rural village located in the Sa Ang of Kandal province in Cambodia. He is married with two children, who are in school. He and his wife earn a living by making snacks to sell in the village. They have been in this business for six years. The current business earns his family about US $5 per day and allows him to save about US $2 each day after daily expenses.

Chantha's microloan is through Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and he is a first time borrower. Now he is applying for a loan. With this loan he is going to buy a decent motorbike to support his business. He hopes to earn more income from his snack selling, so as to set aside some money to fulfill his dream of keeping his children in school.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for his business

loans.name: Ele

texts.en: Ele is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes, ice cakes, pani popo, and keke puaa in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience in this business. Ele needs a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks, etc. to expand her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family and save some money for her business. Ele has been a member of SPBD for one year.

loans.use: to pay for sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, frying pans, forks, etc.

loans.name: Leav's Group

texts.en: Leav is a 56-year-old mother and widow residing in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province.  She is a Khmer noodle seller in the local area. She has been making  a living in this business for 20 years and is able to earn up to 28,900 KHR per day. Her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) was five cycles ago. She has repaid back her past loans and they have enabled her to provide decent meals three times a day for her family. Now, she is in a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to support her business, especially in buying more ingredients for making noodles. She hopes that she can earn more income in order to stable her living status.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make noodles

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha lives in a thatched roof house in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province.  He 42 years old and married. He and his wife have six children, some of whom are still in school while the others work at the family’s business. He and his wife earn a living through farming rice and making palm juice.  They have been in this business for almost twenty years. With his current business, he is able to earn approximately 30,000 KHR per day to support his family. 

This is the first loan for Chantha with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  He is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR. He is going to use the loan to renovate his old house. He hopes this loan will enable him to have a decent house for living in so as to improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: renovate his house

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en: Domingo is a farmer who lives in a rural community. He is 42 years old, married, but has no children yet. Farming is the main source of their living. They plant corn and vegetables and raise livestock to sell. They aimed to improve their farming business in order to satisfy their necessities and save some for future emergencies. He planned to expand his corn plantation to ensure a high production, but due to insufficient capital, he is asking for an additional PHP 25,000 to buy herbicides, fertilizers and pay the expenses incurred in planting corn. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers and pay the expenses incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Sreypov

texts.en:
Sreypov, a villager from Takeo province in Cambodia, is 31 years old and married. She has one little daughter to care for. To earn a living, she works at the local factory, while her husband grows rice and works at construction sites for additional income. 

Sreypov is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has repaid back completely, empowered her to stabilize her lifestyle and improve her livelihood. 

Since the transportation cost of getting to the factory is quite a huge burden, Sreypov is applying for a new loan to buy a decent motorbike for commuting back and forth to her workplace. She hopes that this purchase will reduce her transportation cost, so she can use that money to support her children instead.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Tang's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kror Kor district of Pursat Province in Cambodia, Tang is a widowed mother who has seven kids. She is 57 years old and currently manages a two and half hectare area for growing rice. The current business earns her about 17,000 KHR per day. Tang has never worked with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She is now forming a group of two women to apply for a new loan. Both of them are seeking 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her dry season rice. She hopes to grow her rice healthily, so she can make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for rice

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is a resident in a rural village in the Sampov Meas district.  She is a 28-year-old mother of three children, all of whom are still too young for school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming, which she has been in for five years. Her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income for his family.  With her current business, Sophea can earn about KHR 20,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the first loan for Sophea with VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy chickens and ducks to raise in order to earn extra income for the family. She hopes to earn more income from her business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy chickens and ducks to raise

loans.name: Borath

texts.en:
Borath is 33 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. To make a living, Borath has been selling vegetables, fruits and rice for four years. The current business earns her about 42,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs, and she can save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  

Borath is the first cycle client with VisionFund.  She is applying for a loan of 2,800,000 KHR to buy more vegetables, fruits and rice to resell. She hopes this loan will help her to increase more income to better off her family’s living condition.

loans.use: buy vegetables, fruits and rice to sell

loans.name: Patras Masih

texts.en:
Patras Masih is a 53-years old man. He lives in Lahore Pakistan. He owns an iron bed frame selling shop near his house. He is a responsible father of 4 children -- 3 sons and 1 daughter. 

Patras Masih's work is fully dependent on the electricity which is available for a very short time in the area. Despite that he always try to fulfill the demands of his customers on time. Presently he is interested in purchasing iron rods and welding rods for his shop.  However, due to the lack of funds he cannot make it.  He wishes to provide educational facility to his children. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy materials for his bedframe business

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy is from a rural village in the Bakan district of Cambodia.  She is 55 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.  She and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living through farming rice and planting vegetables. To gain more income to better support the family, her husband also works for others for a fee. She and her husband have been in this business for almost twenty years. 

Khy has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two cycles. She completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family’s business. Now she is applying for another loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy a hand tractor to support her rice paddy business. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her business and make more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Thoern's Group

texts.en:
Thoern is 37 years old and married. She lives in a rural village in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province.  She has six children, four of whom are dependent on her and still in school.  Thoern is a housewife while her husband works as a construction worker in the local area to support his family. The current business earns her family about 46,000 KHR per day and she can save about 25,000KHR each day after offsetting her daily expenses. 

Thoern’s group consists of two members who are both female.  Thoern has been with VisionFund for four cycles while her group member is just with VisionFund this cycle.  Thoern has used the first loan successfully to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. As the leader, Thoern will use her portion to renovate her old kitchen. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a new kitchen for her family to use.

loans.use: to renovate her kitchen

loans.name: Veasna's Group

texts.en:
Veasna is a resident from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district.  She is a 39-year-old mother of two children, both of whom are still too young for school. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and working for others for a fee, which she has been doing for ten years. With her current business, Veansa can earn about KHR 60,000 per day to spend for daily expenses. 

This is the fifth loan for Veansa with VisionFund, while the other group member has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Veasna had successfully paid back her previous loan. Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor and land plowing. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy pay for fertilizer and plowing

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en:
Sarin is originally from a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battmbang province.  She is a 62-year-old mother of nine children. Rice farming has been the only source of income for her family for ten years. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.  

Sarin’s group consists of three members who live in the same village.  Sarin is in her seventh cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, Sarin, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 49 years old and was graced with two children. She is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in generating income. She works in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She aims to improve the business and make it profitable in order to help in financing the education of their children, and to help provide their necessities. Due to financial insufficiency, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. She believes that someday, she will make more improvements in the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Yeab

texts.en:
Veab is originally from the Sampov Meas district of Pursat Province.  She is 44 years old and a mother with eight children—three of whom are still in school and need her support. She has three hectares of land for growing rice and it is the primary source of the familiy's income. She has been involved in her current business for ages. 

Veab is in her fourth borrowing cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). After completing the previous loans, which has helped her to uplift her living and her business, she feels confident that she can keep up a good progress in her business. She is now seeking a new loan to buy a mini-tractor to support her farmland. She hopes to reduce the plowing fee which she used to have and to use that money to buy good food for her children instead.

loans.use: buy a mini-tractor

loans.name: Mareva Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Mareva vive en Orquídeas (Guayaquil), ella tiene 36 años de edad.  Ella comenzó con un dinero que recibió y se puso su bazar, para hacer producir aquel dinero y tener ingresos económicos para su hogar.
Ella realiza su labor desde su casa, empieza desde muy de mañana hasta la noche.
 
La dificultad que ella tiene en su negocio es la competencia que hay por el barrio.  Ella no está casada, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad (aparece en la foto) y estudia en una escuela particular por lo que trabaja muy duro para darle una buena educación a su hijo.

Ella usara el préstamo para comprar mercadería para el bazar como: cuadernos, plumas, lápices, etc. Ella desea en el futuro poder expandir más su bazar y tener más clientela.
texts.en:
Sra. Mareva is 36 years old and lives in Orquídeas (Guayaquil). With some money she received, Mareva opened a bazaar so that she could generate household income.

She works from home, starting in the morning and continuing into the night. The difficulty she faces in her business is dealing with the existing competition in her neighborhood. Mareva is not married and has an eight-year-old son (who appears with her in the photo). He attends a private school, so Mareva works very hard so that he can have a good education.

She will use this loan to buy merchandise for her bazaar such as notebooks, pens, pencils, and other items. In the future, she would like to expand her bazaar even more and acquire more customers.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, pencils, and other items.

loans.name: Jose Gabriel

texts.es:
Jose, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir para su negocio. Esta compra le permitirá reparar su vehículo, el cual lo necesita  para ir a vender  todos los días y lo demás lo utilizara para la compra de mercadería para la tienda y asi brindarle un mejor servicio a los clientes. 
El  crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar su utilidad y mejorar sus ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan in order to invest for his business. This purchase will allow him to repair his vehicle, which he needs to make sales every day. He will use the rest of the loan to purchase merchandise for his store, and in this way offer better service to his customers.

The previous loan helped him to increase his profits and improve his earnings. His family circumstances are maintaining.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn is aged 49 years old and married. She is the mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice on seven hectares of farmland for ten years. The current business earns her about 32,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  

Horn’s group consists of four female members who live in the same village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a sixth-cycled client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Horn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Domingo Antonio

texts.es:
El Joven Domingo  es originaria del municipio san Rafael del sur, Nicaragua. es profesor de educación secundaria imparte la clase de física, química y biología tiene seis años de trabajar para este colegio. 

Este joven es soltero vive en casa de sus padres, pequeña humilde con mucho calor humano, solicita a ceprodel un financiamiento, para poder ayudarle  a sus padres a realizar las mejoras de su casa.

"Me siento muy bien trabajar con ceprodel porque he visto mi crecimiento como persona y el de mi familia".
texts.en:
Domingo is a young man who is originally from the town of San Rafael del Sur, Nicaragua. He is a high school instructor who has been teaching physics, chemistry, and biology for the past six years.

Domingo is a single young man who lives at his parents’ house, a small humble abode filled with warmth. He is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL so that he can help his parents with making improvements to their house.

Domingo says, “I feel very good about working with CEPRODEL because I have seen growth as a person, as well as with my family.”

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and blocks for making improvements to his parents' house.

loans.name: Younus

texts.en:
Since 2010, Younus has been selling polythene bags in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and honest man. He works 13 hours a day. His parents have grown old and he is the only person who looks after them. This shop is the only source of income for his family so he wants to grow his business. 

He has requested a loan amount of 100,000 PKR from BRAC Pakistan to purchase polythene bags and plastic boxes to sell. He wishes to send his parents for haj (pilgrimage). He has a strong belief that he will be a successful person one day.

loans.use: To purchase polythene bags and plastic boxes to sell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en: Allan is 39 years old and single. He lives with his parents in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to the hardship of living he also engages in raising ducks that lay eggs for sale. He aims to improve the business and the family's status of living in order to satisfy their necessities and save some for his future. He planned to raise more ducks but he has not enough capital. He is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy duck feed, netting and additional ducks to raise. He hopes that the loan will help him improve the business and that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy duck feed, netting and additional ducks to raise

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en: Due to hardship of living, Ricky engages in raising ducks in his village to have eggs for sale. He is now 38 years old and single. He aims to uplift his  status of living in order to support his parents, who are now old and weak. He planned to raise more ducks and build a shelter for them but he has inadequate capital. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy duck feed, netting and a tent for his ducks. Through this loan, he believes that he will improve the business and make it profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy duck feed, netting and a tent for the ducks

loans.name: Marvelyn

texts.en: Marvelyn is a responsible mother who supports her husband by generating income. She is 53 years old and has seven children. Being responsible parents, they aimed to upgrade their status of living in order to satisfy their necessities and give their children a better life. In this regard, they help each other manage their furniture making business to generate sufficient income. They aimed to improve the business but they have inadequate capital. For this reason, Marvelyn is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000.00 to buy wood and materials needed in furniture making. They are hoping that this loan will enable them to improve the business and make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood and materials needed in furniture making

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Monica Alexandra

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de una chica de 19 años que nos quiere contar una experiencia vivida…. 
Ella quiso compartir con nosotros un momento de su vida donde pensó que estudiar era imposible!!! 
El año pasado viajo a un lugar alejado de la civilización  a vivir con su padre en donde se encuentra viviendo actualmente. Con el fin de estudiar y poderse presentar a la universidad nacional.
El día esperado llego y se presentó lastimosamente se presentó pero no aprobó el examen de admisión, se quedó por nueve puntos…
Después de esto no deserto y se presentó para estudiar en el Sena en donde alcanzo a estudiar cuatro meses de contabilidad básica y algo de portugués lastimosamente no pudo seguir estudiando ya que el Sena tuvo un inconveniente ya que se finalizaba el convenio que tenían con el departamento de Leticia así que decidió regresar a la ciudad a vivir con su madre y sus hermanos ya que en ese sitio se agotaban más las posibilidades y la ilusión de estudiar y algún día llegar a ser una gran profesional y ahora nuevamente se le da la posibilidad de estudiar lo que realmente quiere que es Contabilidad Financiera en donde se encuentra ha siendo primer semestre.
texts.en:
This is 19-year-old Monica's story:

Monica wanted to tell us about a time in her life when she thought that it would be impossible to study.

Last year she travelled to a place far away from civilization, to live with her father. She still lives there now.  Her objective was to study and to join the national university.

The long-awaited day arrived; she went to the university but she did not pass the admission exam.  She had only nine points.

After this she did not give up and applied to study at the Sena public education institute.  There she studied basic accounting and some Portuguese for four months.  Disappointingly she could not continue her studies as the Sena had problems and terminated an agreement with the Leticia region.  So, Monica decided to return to the city to live with her mother and siblings, as there there are more opportunities, the chance to study and one day to become a professional.  Now Monica again has the possibility of studying what she really wanted to study - Accounting and Finances.  She is now in her first semester.

loans.use: to complete her studies in Accounting and Finances.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
Janeth, de 22 años de edad,es soltera y sin hijos.  Vive en compañía de su madre y sus 03 hermanos, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre.La actividad que realiza Janeth es la venta de ropas confeccionadas por su madre, tanto de damas, caballeros y niños. Todos estos productos lo confecciona su madre en su pequeño taller y  se  encarga de venderlos entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera cordial y amable, logrando ganarse su preferencia. 
Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento tiene el apoyo de toda su familia.
Le gusta su negocio ya que le genera ingresos económicos que le sirvieron para pagar sus estudios superiores, apoyar a sus hermanos menores con sus estudios y los gastos de su hogar; y además de atender a las personas de manera amable, logrando ganarse una clientela regular. Por otro lado tiene planes de planes de formalizar su negocio y hacerlo crecer.Este será el préstamo número 05 con Kiva y está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual .
Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 nuevos soles, comprará materiales de costura como hilos, telas, elásticos y otros, para confeccionar ropas de damas, caballeros y niños, buscando precios más bajos para sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
22-year-old Janeth is single and has no children. She lives with her mother and her three siblings, living comfortably in her mother’s house. Janeth’s work is selling clothes made by her mother for ladies, gentlemen, and children.

Her mother makes all these products in her small workshop and Janeth undertakes to sell them to their relatives, friends, and neighbours, to whom she attends in a polite and friendly manner, thereby gaining their preference.

She has spent more than three years working in this business and up until now has had the support of her whole family.

She likes her business since it generates income which allows her to pay for her tertiary studies, help her younger siblings with their studies, and help with the household expenses. She likes attending to people in a friendly manner, and managing to build up a regular clientele. She has plans to formalize her business and make it grow. This will be her fifth loan with Kiva and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. She promises to make her loan repayments on time.

With the requested amount of 800 PEN, she will buy sewing materials such as thread, fabric, and elastic in order to make clothes for ladies, gentlemen, and children, and she will look for lower prices by purchasing in cash and in bulk.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es:
María tiene 20 años de edad es madre soltera vive con su madre tiene 1 hijo en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

La V.R.C Mushuc Pakari está conformada por 10 socios se dedica a la agricultura a 40 minutos de la oficina.

María se dedica a vender papas y queso. Se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de papas, Habas. Además se dedica a la crianza de animales como son vacas, cerdos, ovejas. Utilizara el dinero del crédito para comprar fertilizantes, urea, herbicidas, vacuna para los animales, polbillos. 

Con el crédito que le otorga la cooperativa podrá mejorar  la siembra, y ganaderia. Las compras las realiza en el cantón Guaranda. El sueño es tener una casa propia. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta en la vida son las plagas y las enfermedades a los animales. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar con la familia.
texts.en:
María is 20 years old. She is a single mother with one son. She lives with her mother in Guaranda Canton, in the province of Bolivar. 

The Mushuc Pakari communal bank is made up of ten people who make a living from agriculture. It is 40 minutes away from the office.

María makes a living from selling potatoes and cheese. She makes a living from agriculture – from sowing potatoes and broad beans. She also makes a living from breeding animals, such as cows, pigs, and sheep. She will use the money from the loan to buy fertilizers, urea, herbicides, vaccinations for her animals, and rice bran.

With the loan granted by Cooperativa San Jose, she will be able to improve her crops and her farming. She will make her purchases in Guaranda Canton. Her dream is to have her own house. The challenges she faces in life are plagues of insects and illnesses affecting her animals. She likes to spend her free time with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, urea, herbicides, and vaccinations

loans.name: Paquita

texts.es:
Paquita, de 52 años de edad,esta casada con Isaías quien se dedica a la agricultura y es padre de sus 04 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Paquita es la venta de plátanos durante el día,  para eso cuenta con una mesa que instala en le frontis de su casa, desde donde atiende de manera muy amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos. También vende comidas preparadas como guisos, juanes, tallarines y otros por las noches.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha permitido salir de sus apuros económicos,ya que se inicio en esta actividad por la necesidad económica que atravesaba y para poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar. Pero, no le gusta cuando algunas veces no puede vender todos sus  productos y se malogra pero eso no la desanima, tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.Este será el prestando numero 5 con Kiva, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero para poder concretar sus planes.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.400 nuevos soles, comprará plátanos e ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceites y otros  a precio por mayor para así tener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
52-year-old Paquita is married to Isaías, who makes a living from agriculture and who is the father of Paquita’s four children. She lives with her husband and her children in her own home. Paquita sells bananas during the day. She has a table for this which she sets up in front of her house, from which she attends to her customers in a polite and friendly manner. The majority of her customers are her neighbours. She also sells food at night, such as stews, juanes [rice and chicken seasoned with turmeric and wrapped in banana leaves], tallerinas [pasta dishes], etc.

She likes her business since it has allowed her to get out of her financial hardship. She started this business out of economic necessity and in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses. She does not like it when she is unable to sell all her produce and it goes rotten, but this does not discourage her; she has plans to make her business grow and increase her sales. This will be her fifth loan with Kiva. She feels grateful for the financial support so she can make her plans a reality.

With the requested amount of 200 PEN, she will buy bananas and ingredients for preparing her food, such as rice, oil, and other things at wholesale prices so that she can obtain good profits.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 27 años de edad , esta casada y es madre de dos pequeños.Comparte sus vivencias familiares con su joven familia en una vivienda que le cedieron sus padres construida a base de madera.
Ocupa el cargo de “Madre cuidadora” cuya labor desempeña haciendo visitas domiciliarias a madres con uno o mas hijos ,llevando información nutricional y otros necesario para su optimo desarrollo y crecimiento personal.
Paralelo a su labor como empleada posee unas parcelas el cual dedica integralmente a la producción de cacao orgánico.Tiene como objetivo a largo plazo la apertura de su propio negocio consistente en una tienda de abarrotes al por mayor y menor.Carmen se muestra muy agradecida por la nueva oportunidad brindada y comenta que los créditos brindados son una buena manera de afrontar diversos gastos necesarios para su hogar.
Desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para contratar a trabajadores del lugar , quienes le ayudaran a cultivar sus sembrios.
texts.en:
27-year old Carmen is married and the mother of two small children. She and her young family live in a wooden house inherited from her parents. Carmen is a childcare worker visiting mothers with one or more children in their homes and providing them with nutritional and other information to ensure their personal development and growth.

As well as this work Carmen owns some land where she grows organic cocoa. Her longterm goal is to open her own business, a grocery store selling goods in small and large quantities. She is very grateful for this new opportunity for a loan and notes that the money helps her pay for necessary household expenses.

She plans to use the S./ 2,000 to hire workers to help her plant her crops.

loans.use: To hire workers to help plant her fields

loans.name: David De Jesus

texts.es: David de 33 años de edad,  es un hombre casado y padre de 3 hijos en las edades de 2 y 8 años. El en su calidad de comerciante,  y trabajando para una empresa, genera los ingresos para sostener a su familia. Se dedica transversalmente a la venta de calzado, ropa deportiva y suéteres, desde que en el año 2011, decidió  buscar alternativas  para  aumentar sus ingresos; así  observando las necesidades de sus compañeras de trabajo en lo relacionado con ropa, camisetas, jeans, empezó a comprar mercancías y a venderle a crédito a estos, su negocio poco a poco ha ido creciendo. Sus ventas   a crédito las realiza de lunes a sábado,  simultaneamente a su trabajo como emleado, y su meta es aumentar su nivel socioeconómico y que sus hijos logren estudiar para que en un futuro tengan gran potencial de éxito. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  en un mayor volumen, para ganar descuentos, camisetas, camisas, pantalones y calzado, pues en su preventa los clientes han encargado estos artículos y necesita responder a su demanda y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente, ante el incremento de su clientela y es justamente la demanda,  lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
33-year-old David is a married man and is the father of three children between the ages of 2 and 8. As a businessman, and working for a business, he generates enough income to support his family. He has made a living from selling shoes, sports clothes and sweaters since 2011, when he decided to search for alternatives to increase his income; he observed the needs of his colleagues in terms of clothing and began to buy merchandise and sell it to them on credit. His business kept growing little by little. His makes sales on credit from Monday to Saturday, at the same time as being an employee of a business, and his goal is to increase his socioeconomic level and for his children to study so that in the future they have great potential for success. 

He is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing he is getting through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, and shoes in bulk in order to get discounts. His customers have ordered these items of clothing and he needs to respond to the demand. His working capital is not sufficient in light of his increased clientele and demand. This means that his loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, and shoes

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Doña Juana es una mujer de 54 años de edad y que a pesar de su edad ella no deja de soñar en grande, ella es casada comprometida con su familia y con su negocio madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos ayudan en las actividades de campo como ser: limpieza, corte, abono, fertilización y otros. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad en lo que es la siembra y cultivo de granos básicos como ser: Maíz, Frijol y Arroz a muy temprana edad ya que es una actividad que practica toda su familia desde hace muchos años. Ella tiene un pequeño negocio por medio del cual ayuda a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar como ser luz, agua, alimentación, vestimenta entre otros mientras la cosecha esta lista para su venta el cual es una pequeña pulperia con venta de lácteos. Ella se dedica hace 20 años a la agricultura y su terreno fue adquirido por medio de una herencia a su esposo. Sus clientes son sus vecinos e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para la compra del producto.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para la compra de semilla certificada para su siembra la cual le vendrá a mejorar su cosecha en cantidad y en calidad.

Su meta es aprovechar al máximo su cosecha para poder cumplir sus sueños que son de poder implementar un mini mercadito el cual no lo hay en la zona donde ella habita; esto vendrá a generar mayores ingresos para su familia y de esa forma crear un capital propio y libre.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana, 54, is a woman that despite her age has not stopped dreaming. She is married and committed to her family and her business. Juana has six children and two of them help her with the agriculture activities: cleaning, trimming and fertilizing, among other. Juana’s parents taught her to sow and harvest grains, such as corn, beans and rice, when she was just a little girl. This is an activity deeply embedded in her family’s tradition.

Juana has a small business – she sells groceries and dairy products – that helps her to contribute with some of the home expenses, like electricity, water, food and clothing, while the crops grow and are ready to be sold. She has worked in agriculture for twenty years; her husband inherited the land where she works. Juana’s customers are her neighbors and some middlemen that visit the region to buy her products.

Juana is requesting a loan to buy certified seeds, something that will improve her crops, both in quantity and quality. Her goal is to make the most of her crops in order to make her dreams come true and open a minimarket, something missing in the region. This would result in higher income for her family and her own, free-to-use capital.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds for her fields.

loans.name: Reina Beatriz

texts.es: Reina de 34 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maíz y sorgo, tiene 12 años de cultivar sus siembras y su experiencia le ha permitido obtener mejores cosechas comercializa con los vendedores de las zona donde ella reside, tambien tiene una pequeña tienda y con la venta de sus cosechas y las ganancias de su tienda ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. Doña Reina solicita un credito para poder comprar mas insumos agricolas que le pemitan seguir con su cosecha como lo ha hecho hasta ahora y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 34-year-old Reina lives with her husband and their two children. She makes a living from agriculture. She grows corn and sorghum. She has been doing this for twelve years and her experience has allowed her to have better harvests. She sells through the merchants of the area where she lives. She also has a small store and with the sales from her harvests and the profits from her store she and her family have managed to get ahead. Reina is requesting a loan in order to be able to buy more agricultural inputs which will allow her to continue sowing and harvesting her crops as she has done up until now, thereby giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila en su negocio de venta de queso y pescado le ha ido muy bien, porque con su credikiva anterior lo provisionó de pescado comprando en el Departamento del Magdalena y con lo que recuperó de sus utilidades, volvió a comprar queso, que también distribuyó por libras entre su clientela. En la actualidad está aplicando nuevamente a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará pescado, para aprovechar los pedidos de su clientela y responderles con un producto fresco y agradable, mientras ella ganará mas dinero. Ella envía a sus financiadores de  Kiva el siguiente mensaje:  “ Gracias por realizarme el préstamo y por su apoyo”.
texts.en: Zoila's fish and cheese selling business has been going well as, with her previous Kiva loan, she was able to buy fish in the department of Magdalena.  With her profits, she then returned to buy cheese that she sold to her customers.  Currently Zoila is applying for another Kiva loan that she will use to buy fish, taking advantage of the orders that her customers have put in.  She will be able to provide a good and fresh product, while making more money.  Zoila has the following message for Kiva lenders: "Thank you for this loan and for you support".

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de verduras,la socia vende cebollas,zapallos,tomates y pepinos,la socia vende en el mercado,ella tiene un puesto donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar le negocio de compra y venta de verduras.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cebollas,zapallos y tomates.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Vanessa continues to make a living buying and selling vegetables.  She sells onions, tomatoes, pumpkins and cucumbers at the local market, where she works from 8am until 6pm.  Vanessa has now had the business for seven years and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand the business.  Vanessa is currently applying for a loan to buy onions, pumpkins and tomatoes.  

Vanessa is happy with the loan and promises to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy onions, pumpkins and tomatoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas; gracias a su trabajo ya está en su ciclo 3 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde casi todas las integrantes ya lograron superar la línea de pobreza; a través del Aumento de Ingreso donde aprendieron la Elaboración de Productos de Limpiezas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirian, quien en su encuesta de eliminación de pobreza esta en el nivel dos, y eso es lo que la motiva aun mas para poder esforzarse y salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas y venta de Bebidas, también se debe destacar el trabajo que esta Sra. esta haciendo, ya que se esfuerza mucho por aprender y día a día superarse. Su meta es poder tener algún día un gran negocio de comidas y seguir deleitando a su clientela con todas las ricas comidas que hace.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Gaseosas, materia prima para la elaboración de la comida carne, harina, huevo entre otros; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Mujeres Unidas [United Women], is in its third cycle of the women committee program, thanks to its members’ work. They took part in the poverty eradication survey, and most of them were found to be above the poverty line. They learned how to make cleaning products through a program to increase their income.

One of the members is Mrs. Mirian, who is in poverty level 2 according to the survey, something that inspires her to work harder and get ahead. Mirian sells empanadas [stuffed bread or pastry baked or fried] and beverages. It is important to highlight her effort to learn and improve more every day. Her goal is to have her own food business one day and continue to delight her customers with the delicious foods she prepares.

Mirian is requesting this loan to buy beverages and ingredients for her food, such as meat, flour and eggs. This will help her to make her business plan a reality and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy beverages and ingredients to prepare food, like meat, flour and eggs.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 38 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maiz y sorgo desde hace varios años, es un hombre responsable y trabajador vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para su siembra como abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. ya que tiene buena clientela y quiere seguir con sus cosechas para obtener mejores ganacias y seguir dandole a su familia lo necesario.
texts.en: Miguel, 38, has been growing corn and sorghum for several years.  He is a responsible, hard-working man who lives in his own house with his wife and children.  The income he is able to earn is to cover household expenses, so he is requesting a loan to buy everything he needs for planting, such as fertilizers, seeds, etc.  He has a good clientele and wants to continue with his crop growing in order to earn more profit and continue giving his family everything they need.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies (fertilizers and seeds).

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Nació en un hogar muy humilde carente de muchas cosas, y con un padre poco responsable su madre vivió con el después del nacimiento de ella  cinco años tarde,  luego se separaron porque su padre les daba mala vida, no los alimentaba y los maltrataba; su madre decidió darse una oportunidad en el amor y la llevo con ella a vivir con otro señor que aparentemente los quería, después de 6 largos años la convivencia con este señor se hizo demasiado imposible por sus malas intenciones  para con ella y con tan solo 13 años de edad decidió  hacerse cargo de su vida con el apoyo de su abuela materna, en una ciudad pequeña no importa la edad solo importa las ganas de trabajar para emplear a alguien y eso le sucedió a ella entonces se vio obligada a dejar sus estudios en el colegio y ponerse a trabajar dure así un año mientras se reponía de todos los daños que este señor le había causado en cuestión de ropa, libros del colegio y calzado, entre otros luego de ese tiempo decidió ingresar a estudiar validando los dos años que le faltaban (décimo y once), con el dinero que se ganaba compro los útiles, uniformes y matricula, acorde con el jefe en ese entonces que la dejara trabajar hasta las seis de la tarde para entrar al colegio a las seis treinta  acepto y así logro estudiar y trabajar seis meses porque resulta que al señor  no le servía que ella se fuera tan temprano pues su jornada normal era de todo el día. Siguió estudiando con lo poco que le podía ayudar su abuela y culmino exitosa mente el bachiller, se mudo a una ciudad  en el 2006, para ese tiempo tenía 16 años  quería trabajar pero era más complicado que en su pueblo,  aun así lo consiguió con un amigo  que tenía un local pequeño donde vendía gorras y correas allí conoció a la persona que ahora es su esposo e iniciaron una bonita relación, su  anhelo siempre ha sido seguir estudiando porque ella ha tenido muy claro que es lo único que ayuda a salir adelante, ingreso a un instituto  estudio un semestre de secretariado y tuvo que retirarse por que resulto embarazada y su embarazo era de alto riesgo, conformo su hogar con el padre de la niña y se dedico a las cosas de la casa y no estudiaba  por cuestión de dinero, tampoco trabajaba por estar con la bebe (actualmente una niña de 5 años), en la actualidad está estudiando gracias a Dios y al esfuerzo que están haciendo pues vivir  tres con un solo salario es complicado  pero se sabe que es una gran inversión para las vidas teniendo en cuenta una oferta laboral mejor remunerada, un ingreso más alto, en la casa no tienen  mucho hay veces que se ven alcanzados ya que no tiene para la mensualidad pero confiamos en Dios y eso les da aliento para confiar que todo estará mejor. Tiene una familia muy unida, cariñosa y por la cual se esfuerza y valora la oportunidad de estar estudiando disfruta cada día que pasa con su hija y trata de enseñarle que hay que luchar por los sueños sin pasar por encima de los demás.
texts.en:
She was born in a very humble home deprived of many things and with an unresponsible father.  Her mother lived with him after the baby was born but five years later they got divorced because of his bad behavior.  He did not feed them and was abusive.  Her mother decided give herself another opportunity for love and she took her daughter to live with another man who apparently loved them.  After six long years of living with this man, his bad intentions toward her made life impossible, so at age 13 she decided to live her own life with the support of her maternal grandmother.  In a small city, it is not the age that matters but rather the determination to work, so this is why she left school and started to work.  She lasted a year doing this while recovering from the harm this man had caused her, in matters of clothing, text books, and shoes, among other things.  After that she decided to go back to school to finish the two years she needed for high school (10th and 11th grades).  She used the money she had earned to buy supplies and uniforms and pay for tuition.  Her boss allowed her to quit work at 6:00 p.m. so that she could go to school at 6:30 p.m.  She was able to study and work for six months, but her boss finally said she was leaving too early at a job that was supposed to last all day.

She continued her studies with the help of her grandmother and finished high school successfully.  She moved to another city in 2006 at age 16 and wanted to work but it was more complicated than in her town.  But she was able to get a job through a friend who had a small hat and belt business.  There she met the person who is now her husband and they began a nice relationship.  She always wanted to continue studying because she felt that was the only way to get ahead.  She began secretarial studies at an academy but had to quit because she got pregnant and it was a high risk pregnancy.  She set up house with the father of her daughter and began to take care of the home and could not continue studying due to financial reasons.  Nor could she work because of the baby (who is now five years old).  Thankfully, she is studying again through much effort because it is difficult for three people to live off of one income.  But she knows it is a great investment for their lives because there will be more well-paid work on offer.  Sometimes there is not enough money at home and they cannot even afford the monthly rent, but they trust in God and that helps them believe things will get better.  She has a very united, caring family who she works hard for.  She values the opportunity to study and to enjoy every day she has with her daughter.  She tries to teach her that one much fight for one's goals without hurting anyone along the way.

loans.use: To finish her accounting education.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 43 años de edad y se dedica en un pequeño local a la venta de ropa y calzado deportivo principalmente. Con los ingresos procedentes de su negocio sostiene su núcleo familiar conformado por su esposa y su hija de 15 años de edad, con quien tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad.  
Su actividad comercial, data de hace 12 años cuando inició de manera independiente, pues toda su vida vio a su madre trabajar  como comerciante,  en locales de un centro comercial reconocido en la ciudad, en el que siempre la acompañó. Sus ventas las realiza desde un punto de ventas en un centro comercial de la ciudad  y sus compras las hace de contado a diferentes proveedores.  Cuenta con clientes que le compran en el local y con otros a quienes les lleva la mercancía a domicilio, porque trabajan en empresas diversas y recupera esta inversión poco a poco, pues le ofrece créditos. Su meta es ampliar su estructura de negocio y aportarle a la profesionalización de su hija, además de adquirir casa propia para aumentar el sosiego familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará ropa femenina , pues espera aumentar sus inventarios para impactar una vez mas a su clientela con la moda en sus productos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 43, has a small shop where he sells clothing and sport shoes, mainly.  With the income he generates at work he is able to support his family, comprised of his wife and 15-year-old daughter, for whom he has great dreams of prosperity.

He has been in business independently for 12 years, since he has always watched and accompanied his mother as she worked as a merchant in a well-known shopping center in the city.  He sells his goods at a shopping center in the city and buys his merchandise from different suppliers.  He has customers who visit the shop, and he also makes home delivery of his merchandise.  He works with different companies who offer credit, so he is able to recover his investment little by little.

His goal is to expand his business and provide his daughter with a career.  He also wants to buy his own house to give his family more stability.  He is requesting a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to buy women's clothing.  He hopes to increase his stock with fashionable products to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing.

loans.name: Blanca Yanira

texts.es:
Blanca, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de comprar productos  tales como: maíz, quesillo, aceite, chicharrón, gas, entre otros para seguir fortaleciendo su negocio.
El crédito anterior le permitió crecer en el negocio, aumentar la clientela y así obtuvo ganancias.
texts.en:
Blanca is requesting a new loan to buy products such as corn, cheese, oil, pork rinds, gas and other items to continue strengthening her business.

The previous loan allowed her to expand her business, increase clientele and earn a profit.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, oil, pork rinds, gas and other items.

loans.name: Jimbere Group

texts.fr:
Donatien fait partie du groupe Jimbere et  habite à Ruyigi. Il  a 33 ans et est marié à Marguerite, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants,tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de haricot et de la bière depuis 10 ans. 

Il  est à son septième  crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes pour préparer de la bière, à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Donatien is part of the Jimbere group and lives in Ruyigi. He is 33 years old and is married to Margaret, a farmer. Together they have four children, all attending school.

He has been trading beans and beer for the past ten years.

This is his seventh credit loan with Turame. Once he obtains the KIVA loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to prepare beer for sale, and so increase his earnings.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas to prepare beer for sale, and so increase his earnings.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 53 years old, married and was blessed with eight children. She and her family live in a rural community and make a living in farming.

Due to financial constraints and to generate additional income, Marilou runs a small general store in her village. She would like to buy more grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital. In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to stock up on soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps and dried fish for resale. 

She believes this loan will help her improve her business and hopes that she can make it more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks, canned goods, beverages, seasonings, snack foods, noodles, laundry soaps and dried fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Martha Estela

texts.es:
Martha, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, vive en casa propia junto a su hijo de 11 años de edad. Ella ya tiene 14 años de dedicarse a su negocio, el cual lo inicio con fondos propios de hace desde hace 15 años. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de productos de consumo basico para el hogar como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, entre otros para ofrecerles más mercadería a  los clientes. Este le ayudara a incrementar el volumen de su negocio con el objetivo de fortalecer los ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida.
Su sueño es aumentar el negocio, brindarle ayuda a su hijo académicamente para que se supere y tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Martha runs a shop selling essential items. She lives in her own house together with her 11-year-old son. She has earned her living from this business for 14 years. She started the business 15 years ago with her own money. 

She is asking for a loan to buy basic consumable products for we home such as rice, beans and sugar so that she can offer her customers more merchandise. This will help her to increase the volume of her business with the aim of increasing her income and improving her quality of life. Her dream is to expand her business and help her son academically so that he succeeds and has the opportunity for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy basic consumable items such as rice, beans and sugar.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar,  solicita un nuevo crédito por la necesidad de más capital para invertir en el cultivo de maíz y frijol. Este le ayudara a comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para llevar acabo el cultivo con todo lo necesario en el momento oportuno.
El préstamo anterior le permitió fortalecer el capital de trabajo y con las ganancias a logrado aportar  a su familia. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado, ya que sus hijos siguen estudiando gracias a la ayuda que ella le brinda por lo que su sueño es formarlos académicamente y sean profesionales de éxito en el fututo.
texts.en:
Oscar is asking for a new loan because he needs more capital to invest in growing corn and beans. This will help him to buy fertilizer, herbicide, pesticides and insecticides to grow his crop with everything he needs at the right time. 

The previous loan allowed him to strengthen his working capital and with the earnings he has been able to support his family. His family circumstances have improved, since his children are still in school thanks to the help offered. His dream is for them to be educated and have successful careers in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides and insecticide.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, tiene una tienda de productos varios. Ella tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y vive en casa propia, disfruta de dos hijos los cuales están estudiando. Reina, vende productos de primera necesidad, posee diez años de experiencia de laborar en este oficio, lo cual lo realiza todos los días de 6:00 am a 8:00 pm, ya que está ubicado en su vivienda.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería tales como: frijoles, azucar, arroz, sal, entre otros para ofrecer a los clientes diversidad de productos y estos queden satisfechos. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su negocio, ya que por medio de este obtiene ganancias para el sustento de y su familia.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sigan estudiando y logren ser profesionales de éxitos en el futuro, brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Reina has a store where she sells various products. She is 51 years old. She is married, lives in her own home, and enjoys her children who are in school.   Reina sells staple products. She has ten years experience working in this profession, which she does every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., since the store is in her house.  

The loan she needs will be invested in buying merchandise such as beans, sugar, rice. salt and more to offer her customers a variety of products so they will be satisfied. This investment will help improve her business, since this way she will make profits to support her family.

Her dream is for her children to stay in school and have successful careers in the future, and to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as beans, sugar, rice, salt and more.

loans.name: Walter Nelson

texts.es:
Don Walter a sus 41 años de edad se dedica a la sastreria confecciona todo tipo de ropa desde hace 20 años,
 trabaja todos los dias de lunes a domingo porque tiene mucha clientela ya que en la zona donde el reside no hay ninguna otra sastreria; con las ganacias que obtiene logar solventar y darle a su familia lo que necesita, vive con su esposa y una hija. Don Walter solicita un cerdito para poder comprar todos los amteriales que le utiliza como: agujas, hilos, tijeras, cinte para medir, entre otras cosas y asi darle a su familia un mejor calidad de vida ya el no cuenta con otros ingresos monetarios.
texts.en:
Walter is 41 years old. He works as a tailor and has made all types of clothing for more than 20 years. He works every day Monday through Sunday because he has a lot of customers, since he is the only tailor in the area where he lives. With the earnings he is able to support his family and give them everything they need. He lives with his wife and one daughter. 

Walter is asking for the loan to buy the materials that he uses, such as: needles, thread, measuring tape, and more. This way, he can give his family a better quality of life, since he doesn't have any other source of income.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mclaren Group

texts.en:
Davis, who is in his mid 50s is married with six children who still go to school. He has been running a general store for fifteen years now. He works from 7.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Davis's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to restock on missing items in his store and started an electronic money transfer (M-pesa and Tigo Pesa) business. He is very hard working. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully, and has been using his profits to pay school fees, build his house and cover household expenses. 

Davis will use this loan to increase the inventory of his general store and to make more electronic money transfers. His dream is to one day be able to build another house to rent.

Davis will share this loan with his loan group "Mclaren" with ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of his general store and to make more electronic money transfers.

loans.name: Neisser

texts.es: Neisser compró moldes y materiales con los que elaboró muchos productos que vendió,  su meta es incrementar su producción gradualmente y generar mayores utilidades. Neisser envía el siguiente mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Agradecimientos por creer en los microempresarios”. En la actualidad está aplicando aun nuevo credikiva con el cual comprará moldes y materiales,  para una vez mas,  producir todo lo que su clientela requiere y hacer de su credikiva toda una inversión exitosa..
texts.en:
Neisser bought molds and materials.  He used them to create a lot of products which he then sold.  His goal is to gradually increase his production and make more profits.  Neisser sends the following message to Kiva lenders "Thank you for believing in micro businesspeople".  

Neisser is currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy molds and materials so that he can, once again, produce everything his customers request and turn his Kiva loan into a really successful investment.

loans.use: to buy molds and materials

loans.name: Jesus Alberto

texts.es: Jesus con su anterior credikiva compró dos lavadoras mas, con ellas aumentó el número de sus clientes y así mismo sus ingesos. Con su credikiva el negocio se ha fortalecido y ha avanzado por eso envió agradecimientos por el apoyo que Kiva ha hecho a su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando nuevamente a un credikiva para adicionar a su actividad diaria, dos computadores y  prestar el servicio de internet de una manera mas efectiva porque en la actuaidad cuenta con 3  y tiene planes de continuar creciendo, aumentando sun inversiones.
texts.en:
Jesus bought two washing machines with his previous loan, which brought him more clients and more income. His business has grown with the loan, so he is very thankful for Kiva's support.

He his currently applying for a new loan to buy two computers and provide internet services more efficiently. He currently has three computers and plans to keep growing by investing more.

loans.use: to buy two computers

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BADEGNA est constitué de 6 femmes mariées et 1 veuve ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies dans le quartier  Heremakono Nord de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré  à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de pomme à l’image de
MAMA, qui est la troisième femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de pomme avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Badegna group is made up of six married women and one widow, who, on average, are 34 years old and have three children.
